lead_paragraph: TISHMAN--John. The Board of Directors, Volunteers and Staff of Ronald McDonald House New York wish to express our sincere sympathy on the passing of our former board member, John L. Tishman. In 1992, with the generous support of Tishman Construction Company, John supervised the construction of the New York City Ronald McDonald House, the world's largest temporary home-away-from-home for pediatric cancer patients and their families. Mr. Tishman will be remembered as a devoted board member and friend of the house that love built. Our sincere sympathy and deepest condolences go out to his two children, Daniel Tishman and Katherine Blacklock, three grandsons and the entire Tishman family on their significant loss. Respectfully, Tina Lundgren, Chairman of the Board; Harris Diamond, Vice Chair, Chairman Elect; Stanley B. Shopkorn, Chairman, Emeritus; Joel Newman, Interim President and Chief Executive Officer; Ronald McDonald House New York 1/3
